trans-unit.source: User's Manual - Content Level A/B Testing
trans-unit.target: User's Manual - Content Level A/B Testing

trans-unit.source: Prerequisite
trans-unit.target: Prerequisite

trans-unit.source: Please follow the step [How to Join the Microsoft GitHub Organization](http://https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service) to link your GitHub account with Microsoft organization.
trans-unit.target: Please follow the step [How to Join the Microsoft GitHub Organization](http://https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service) to link your GitHub account with Microsoft organization.

trans-unit.source: Read the CSI instruction to understand the process how to **CREATE** / **EDIT** / **COMMIT** markdown file to GitHub.
trans-unit.target: Read the CSI instruction to understand the process how to **CREATE** / **EDIT** / **COMMIT** markdown file to GitHub.

trans-unit.source: This manual really don't take content creation/revision into consideration.
trans-unit.target: This manual really don't take content creation/revision into consideration.

trans-unit.source: Use **working** branch before merge into Live environment which is always a **BEST PRACTICE**.
trans-unit.target: Use **working** branch before merge into Live environment which is always a **BEST PRACTICE**.

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step

trans-unit.source: Create a new experiment
trans-unit.target: Create a new experiment

trans-unit.source: Part I: Set up the experimental files in your working branch.
trans-unit.target: Part I: Set up the experimental files in your working branch.

trans-unit.source: The A/B test requires two separate markdown files, the A variant, and the B variant.
trans-unit.target: The A/B test requires two separate markdown files, the A variant, and the B variant.

trans-unit.source: You may already have an A variant as an existing published page.
trans-unit.target: You may already have an A variant as an existing published page.

trans-unit.source: Switch to your **working** branch:
trans-unit.target: Switch to your **working** branch:

trans-unit.source: If you are working locally, switch to your local staging branch.
trans-unit.target: If you are working locally, switch to your local staging branch.

trans-unit.source: The staging branch is whichever branch you use to commit changes that will be published to [stage endpoint](https://stage.docs.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: The staging branch is whichever branch you use to commit changes that will be published to [stage endpoint](https://stage.docs.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: Edit Variant A Page:
trans-unit.target: Edit Variant A Page:

trans-unit.source: Edit your source file (Page A) by adding the following metadata::
trans-unit.target: Edit your source file (Page A) by adding the following metadata::

trans-unit.source: is the unique id for your experiment.
trans-unit.target: is the unique id for your experiment.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that your experiment id be of the form <your\_alias>-<experiment\_name>-<YYYYMMDD
trans-unit.target: We recommend that your experiment id be of the form <your\_alias>-<experiment\_name>-<YYYYMMDD

trans-unit.source: Create Variant B Page:
trans-unit.target: Create Variant B Page:

trans-unit.source: Create a Variant B page for the topic in the same folder using all of Page A's original metadata.
trans-unit.target: Create a Variant B page for the topic in the same folder using all of Page A's original metadata.

trans-unit.source: Add the `experiment_id` field and use the same experiment ID you created for the A variant.
trans-unit.target: Add the `experiment_id` field and use the same experiment ID you created for the A variant.

trans-unit.source: Use the following file name structure when you save the Variant B page: <sourcefilename>`.experimental.md`.
trans-unit.target: Use the following file name structure when you save the Variant B page: <sourcefilename>`.experimental.md`.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If A Variant is CSI-demo.md, then B Variant should be CSI-demo.experimental.md
trans-unit.target: If A Variant is CSI-demo.md, then B Variant should be CSI-demo.experimental.md

trans-unit.source: Add and commit your changes:
trans-unit.target: Add and commit your changes:

trans-unit.source: If you are working locally, you will have to merge these local changes with the staging branch on GitHub with a pull request.
trans-unit.target: If you are working locally, you will have to merge these local changes with the staging branch on GitHub with a pull request.

trans-unit.source: If you are working on GitHub, simply commit the changes.
trans-unit.target: If you are working on GitHub, simply commit the changes.

trans-unit.source: Once the files are committed to the staging branch on GitHub, it will automatically trigger the OP build for the staging branch.
trans-unit.target: Once the files are committed to the staging branch on GitHub, it will automatically trigger the OP build for the staging branch.

trans-unit.source: Preview the result from portal:
trans-unit.target: Preview the result from portal:

trans-unit.source: Open OP Portal, wait until the build is completed without error message.
trans-unit.target: Open OP Portal, wait until the build is completed without error message.

trans-unit.source: Open stage site and preview the result.
trans-unit.target: Open stage site and preview the result.

trans-unit.source: Merge your Variant A and Variant B to Live branch
trans-unit.target: Merge your Variant A and Variant B to Live branch

trans-unit.source: Once you've confirmed that the A and B variants are available on the staging server, merge your Variant A and Variant B files to the **Live** branch for publication to the production site.
trans-unit.target: Once you've confirmed that the A and B variants are available on the staging server, merge your Variant A and Variant B files to the **Live** branch for publication to the production site.

trans-unit.source: Part II: Create an Experiment on A/B Testing Configuration Portal.
trans-unit.target: Part II: Create an Experiment on A/B Testing Configuration Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create an experiment:
trans-unit.target: Create an experiment:

trans-unit.source: Open [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments), and click **ADD EXPERIMENT** to create a new experiment.
trans-unit.target: Open [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments), and click **ADD EXPERIMENT** to create a new experiment.

trans-unit.source: Save the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Save the experiment.

trans-unit.source: You will be returned to the experimentation portal front page.
trans-unit.target: You will be returned to the experimentation portal front page.

trans-unit.source: Preview the result by adding prefix `https://stage.docs.microsoft.com/_chrome/experiment.htm#` to switch between your Page A and B.
trans-unit.target: Preview the result by adding prefix `https://stage.docs.microsoft.com/_chrome/experiment.htm#` to switch between your Page A and B.

trans-unit.source: Setup Metrics:
trans-unit.target: Setup Metrics:

trans-unit.source: Expand the experiment from [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments).
trans-unit.target: Expand the experiment from [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments).

trans-unit.source: Click **EDIT** from **METRIC CONFIG** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click **EDIT** from **METRIC CONFIG** tab.

trans-unit.source: Start the experiment:
trans-unit.target: Start the experiment:

trans-unit.source: Click the **START** button to start the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Click the **START** button to start the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring and Reports
trans-unit.target: Monitoring and Reports

trans-unit.source: Monitor the metric counters:
trans-unit.target: Monitor the metric counters:

trans-unit.source: Select the counter from **Metrics Counter**, and click **METRIC RESULT** to show the result.
trans-unit.target: Select the counter from **Metrics Counter**, and click **METRIC RESULT** to show the result.

trans-unit.source: (NOTE, it will takes about 4-6 hrs to show the result because of the latency time from WEDCS)
trans-unit.target: (NOTE, it will takes about 4-6 hrs to show the result because of the latency time from WEDCS)

trans-unit.source: Offline metric report:
trans-unit.target: Offline metric report:

trans-unit.source: Click **ADD** button on the Metrics Report from left panel to Create a report.
trans-unit.target: Click **ADD** button on the Metrics Report from left panel to Create a report.

trans-unit.source: Click "Run Report" in the button of the foorm.
trans-unit.target: Click "Run Report" in the button of the foorm.

trans-unit.source: Export the report to .cvs file once it is **FINISHED**
trans-unit.target: Export the report to .cvs file once it is **FINISHED**

trans-unit.source: Clean up A/B testing once it is completed.
trans-unit.target: Clean up A/B testing once it is completed.

trans-unit.source: Backup the result Export the result from METRIC RESULT to Excel:
trans-unit.target: Backup the result Export the result from METRIC RESULT to Excel:

trans-unit.source: Open A/B Configuration portal, and select the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Open A/B Configuration portal, and select the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Select the Metric, click **METRIC RESULT** tab, and then click **EXPORT EXCEL** to export the result.
trans-unit.target: Select the Metric, click **METRIC RESULT** tab, and then click **EXPORT EXCEL** to export the result.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the **EXPORT EXCEL** for all the related metrics.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the **EXPORT EXCEL** for all the related metrics.

trans-unit.source: Stop the experiment:
trans-unit.target: Stop the experiment:

trans-unit.source: Click the **STOP** button to stop the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Click the **STOP** button to stop the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Delete the experiment from [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments):
trans-unit.target: Delete the experiment from [A/B Configuration portal](https://abtestingportal.azurewebsites.net/#/experiments):

trans-unit.source: Click **DELETE** button to remove the experiment from the list.
trans-unit.target: Click **DELETE** button to remove the experiment from the list.

trans-unit.source: Clean up unnecessary Variant version.
trans-unit.target: Clean up unnecessary Variant version.

trans-unit.source: Once the experiment is finished, you should keep the final version, and delete the unnecessary version from document repo.
trans-unit.target: Once the experiment is finished, you should keep the final version, and delete the unnecessary version from document repo.

trans-unit.source: If choose Variant A, delete the Variant B.
trans-unit.target: If choose Variant A, delete the Variant B.

trans-unit.source: If choose Variant B, copy the content from Variant B to Variant A and delete Variant B.
trans-unit.target: If choose Variant B, copy the content from Variant B to Variant A and delete Variant B.

trans-unit.source: Clean up metadata from Markdown file
trans-unit.target: Clean up metadata from Markdown file

trans-unit.source: Remove `experimental: true` and `experiment_id` from final Markdown file
trans-unit.target: Remove `experimental: true` and `experiment_id` from final Markdown file

trans-unit.source: Commit changes.
trans-unit.target: Commit changes.

trans-unit.source: Other Resources
trans-unit.target: Other Resources
